messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] ukiyo-e Japanese war prints
messages.msgSnippet: Ron, Collecting, an Unruly Passion, Psychological  Perspectives by Werner Muensterberger is an interesting if sometimes slightly uncomfortably accurate read.
messages.messageBody:
Ron,
"Collecting, an Unruly Passion, Psychological Perspectives" by Werner Muensterberger is an interesting if sometimes slightly uncomfortably accurate read. (Princeton University Press, 1994.)

Jim




Looking on-line, I thought there would be more pictures shown. However, it is interesting to note that this collector lectures on "The Phycology of a Collector." (Might try to sit in on one of his lectures sometime, if I can hear about it scheduled somewhere.) He also makes some comments about disposal of one's collection.

Ron
STL

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

Looking on-line, I thought there would be more pictures shown. However, it is interesting to note that this collector lectures on "The Phycology of a Collector." (Might try to sit in on one of his lectures sometime, if I can hear about it scheduled somewhere.) He also makes some comments about disposal of one's collection.

----- Original Message -----
From: Ron Hartmann
To: TOKEN ; nihontostudy ; nihonto@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Saturday, January 07, 2006 12:34 PM
Subject: [nihontostudy] ukiyo-e Japanese war prints


Hi all -

Today's St. Louis Post-Dispatch has an interesting article featuring a local collector of Japanese "war prints" -- woodblock prints -- from the wars with China (1894) and Russia (1904). Not a lot of detail but an interesting write-up neverthless. Thought some of you might enjoy reading it. http://tinyurl.com/8acwl

Obviously this collector and his wife are upper-crust St.Louisans and probably not too accessible, but it sounds like one day they hope to exhibit their collection which would be nice. Again, just passing it along. I'm sure there are a number of list members who collect such war prints. I've always found these interesting but have never allowed myself "another interest." Have enough!!

Ron
STL

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
